canonical_explanation.text: Patterns are arrangements that repeat following a rule. We can make patterns using shapes (circle, square, triangle, star, etc.) and colors (red, blue, green, yellow, etc.). Simple repeating patterns like AB repeat two items: circle, square, circle, square. More complex patterns include ABC (three items repeating), AABB (two of each repeating), and ABB (one then two). To extend a pattern, find the repeating group and continue it. You can also create your own original patterns by choosing a rule and following it. A symmetrical pattern looks the same on both sides of a middle line, like a mirror image.
rules: A repeating pattern has a core group that repeats over and over.
An ABC pattern repeats three different items: A, B, C, A, B, C.
An AABB pattern repeats two of each: A, A, B, B, A, A, B, B.
An ABB pattern repeats one then two: A, B, B, A, B, B.
To extend a pattern, identify the repeating core and continue it.
A symmetrical pattern has two halves that are mirror images of each other.
You can create original patterns by choosing shapes or colors and making a rule.

questions.question_text: What comes next? Red Circle, Blue Square, Red Circle, Blue Square, Red Circle, ___
What is the repeating group in this pattern? Green Star, Yellow Heart, Green Star, Yellow Heart, Green Star, Yellow Heart

options.text: Green Star, Yellow Heart, Green Star

questions.question_text: Riya made a pattern: Red Triangle, Blue Diamond, Red Triangle, Blue Diamond. She wants to add 4 more shapes. What should she add?

options.text: Red Triangle, Blue Diamond, Red Triangle, Blue Diamond
Blue Diamond, Red Triangle, Blue Diamond, Red Triangle
Red Triangle, Red Triangle, Blue Diamond, Blue Diamond
Blue Diamond, Blue Diamond, Red Triangle, Red Triangle

questions.question_text: Which of these is an ABC pattern?

options.text: Circle, Square, Triangle, Circle, Square, Triangle
Circle, Square, Square, Circle, Square, Square

questions.question_text: What comes next? Red, Red, Blue, Blue, Red, Red, Blue, Blue, Red, Red, ___
Arjun made this pattern: Star, Heart, Diamond, Star, Heart, Diamond, Star, ___. What are the next two shapes?
Which pattern type is this: Square, Square, Circle, Circle, Triangle, Triangle, Square, Square, Circle, Circle, Triangle, Triangle?
A pattern starts: Triangle, Circle, Circle, Triangle, Circle, Circle. What is the repeating group and what comes next?

options.text: Triangle, Circle repeats; next is Triangle
Triangle, Circle, Circle repeats; next is Triangle
Circle, Circle repeats; next is Circle
Triangle, Triangle repeats; next is Circle

questions.question_text: Meera wants to create a pattern using Square, Circle, and Star that repeats every 3 shapes. Which could be her pattern?

options.text: Square, Circle, Star, Square, Circle, Star
Square, Square, Circle, Circle, Star, Star
Square, Circle, Square, Star, Square, Circle
Star, Star, Star, Circle, Circle, Circle

questions.question_text: Which arrangement is symmetrical? (Both sides look the same from the middle.)
Red, Blue, Green, Blue, Red is a symmetrical pattern. What is the middle color?
Which color pattern uses shapes AND colors repeating together? Blue Triangle, Red Star, Blue Triangle, Red Star
Which is an AABB pattern?

options.text: Red, Blue, Red, Blue, Red, Blue
Red, Blue, Blue, Red, Blue, Blue
Red, Red, Blue, Blue, Red, Red, Blue, Blue
Red, Blue, Green, Red, Blue, Green

questions.question_text: Rohan created this pattern: Diamond, Diamond, Star, Diamond, Diamond, Star. If he extends it by 6 more shapes, how many Stars will he add?
A symmetrical pattern looks the same on both sides of the ___.
Complete the pattern: Square, Circle, Square, Circle, Square, ___.
Complete the pattern: Red, Green, Red, Green, Red, ___.
Complete the pattern: Triangle, Circle, Star, Triangle, Circle, ___.
Complete the AABB pattern: Blue, Blue, Yellow, Yellow, Blue, Blue, Yellow, ___.
In the pattern Heart, Heart, Star, Heart, Heart, Star, the repeating group is Heart, Heart, ___.
Extend this pattern by one shape: Diamond, Circle, Circle, Diamond, Circle, Circle, ___.
A pattern has the rule 'two squares then one triangle.' The pattern so far is: Square, Square, Triangle, Square, Square, Triangle, Square, Square, ___.
Complete the symmetrical pattern: Star, Heart, ___, Heart, Star.
Complete the symmetrical color pattern: Red, Blue, Green, ___, Red.
In the pattern Red, Green, Blue, Red, Green, Blue, the pattern type is an ___ pattern.
The pattern Circle, Square, Circle, Square, Circle, Square is a repeating pattern.
In the pattern Red, Blue, Red, Blue, the repeating group is Red, Blue, Blue.
Triangle, Square, Diamond, Triangle, Square, Diamond is an ABC pattern.
Red, Red, Blue, Blue, Red, Red, Blue, Blue is an ABB pattern.
Star, Circle, Circle, Star, Circle, Circle is an ABB pattern.
If a pattern is Circle, Triangle, Triangle, Circle, Triangle, Triangle, the next shape is Circle.
To extend the pattern Square, Heart, Diamond, Square, Heart, Diamond, the next three shapes are Heart, Diamond, Square.
The pattern Red, Blue, Blue, Red is symmetrical.
The pattern Circle, Square, Triangle, Circle, Square is symmetrical.
Any group of shapes placed in a row forms a pattern.
Match each pattern with its type.

match_pairs.left: Circle, Square, Triangle, Circle, Square, Triangle
Circle, Circle, Square, Square, Circle, Circle, Square, Square
Circle, Square, Square, Circle, Square, Square

correct_answer: Circle, Square, Circle, Square - AB pattern
Circle, Square, Triangle, Circle, Square, Triangle - ABC pattern
Circle, Circle, Square, Square, Circle, Circle, Square, Square - AABB pattern
Circle, Square, Square, Circle, Square, Square - ABB pattern

correct_answer: Red, Green, Blue, Red, Green, Blue - Red, Green, Blue

questions.question_text: Match each pattern with the correct next two items.
correct_answer: Square, Circle, Circle, Square, ... - Circle, Circle
Star, Star, Heart, Star, Star, ... - Heart, Star
Blue, Green, Red, Blue, ... - Green, Red
Yellow, Yellow, Pink, Pink, Yellow, ... - Yellow, Pink

correct_answer: Red, Blue, Green, Red - Not Symmetrical
Blue, Blue, Red, Green, Green - Not Symmetrical

questions.question_text: Match each rule with the pattern it describes.

match_pairs.right: Circle, Circle, Square, Circle, Circle, Square
Star, Heart, Heart, Star, Heart, Heart
Red, Blue, Yellow, Red, Blue, Yellow

match_pairs.left: Same shape, two colors alternating in pairs
match_pairs.right: Red Circle, Red Circle, Blue Circle, Blue Circle

correct_answer: Two circles then one square - Circle, Circle, Square, Circle, Circle, Square
One star then two hearts - Star, Heart, Heart, Star, Heart, Heart
Three colors taking turns - Red, Blue, Yellow, Red, Blue, Yellow
Same shape, two colors alternating in pairs - Red Circle, Red Circle, Blue Circle, Blue Circle

questions.question_text: Match each pattern with the total number of items in one repeating group.

match_pairs.left: Red, Green, Blue, Red, Green, Blue
Star, Star, Heart, Heart, Star, Star, Heart, Heart
Triangle, Square, Square, Triangle, Square, Square

correct_answer: Red, Green, Blue, Red, Green, Blue - 3
Star, Star, Heart, Heart, Star, Star, Heart, Heart - 4
Triangle, Square, Square, Triangle, Square, Square - 3

questions.question_text: Match each pattern with the correct description.

match_pairs.left: Red Star, Blue Star, Red Star, Blue Star
Red Circle, Red Square, Red Circle, Red Square
Red Circle, Blue Square, Red Circle, Blue Square
Red Circle, Red Circle, Red Circle

correct_answer: Red Star, Blue Star, Red Star, Blue Star - Color changes, shape stays same
Red Circle, Red Square, Red Circle, Red Square - Shape changes, color stays same
Red Circle, Blue Square, Red Circle, Blue Square - Both shape and color change
Red Circle, Red Circle, Red Circle - Nothing changes

questions.question_text: Put these in the correct order to continue the pattern: The pattern is Circle, Square, Circle, Square. Arrange the next 4 shapes.
Arrange the next 3 items to continue the ABC pattern: Triangle, Star, Heart, Triangle, Star, Heart, ___.
Arrange the next 4 items to continue the AABB pattern: Red, Red, Blue, Blue, ___.
Arrange these 3 shapes to extend the pattern: Diamond, Circle, Circle, Diamond, Circle, Circle, ___.
Arrange these 6 shapes to make two full repeats of an ABB pattern using Star and Heart: Star, Heart, Heart, Star, Heart, Heart.
Arrange these 5 colors to make a symmetrical pattern: Blue, Red, Green, Red, Blue.
Arrange these 7 shapes to form a symmetrical pattern: Circle, Triangle, Square, Star, Square, Triangle, Circle.
